image.altText: Nicolás Maduro walks in tandem with officers inside New York law enforcement offices.

props.synopsis: Deposed Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is in New York awaiting a court appearance as more damage of US strikes in Venezuela is revealed. Follow live.

title.children: Maduro in custody in New York awaiting court as aftermath of strikes revealed

image.altText: A graphic of Nicolas Maduro and Donald Trump in grey, facing each other in front of a Venezuela outline in the country's colours

props.synopsis: Even in a world that has grown used to a cavalier attitude to international law from Donald Trump, the move stuns leaders across the globe.

title.children: Trump's blatant disregard for international law is one thing. The reaction is another

image.altText: Two women hold yellow, blue, red flags.

props.synopsis: Venezuelan migrants across Latin America and other parts of the world cheered in the streets, supporting the US mission to capture Venezuela's deposed president, Nicolás Maduro.

title.children: Venezuelans across the globe divided over US mission to capture Maduro

image.altText: Steve Smith and Cameron Green look a little downcast while leaving the field at the SCG

props.synopsis: Only the rain could slow England's progress on day one in Sydney, as a weary Australia reflected its coach's claims the series really ended in Adelaide.

title.children: Weary Australia eyes Ashes finish line as England senses opportunity

image.altText: Damien Martyn plays in the nets

props.synopsis: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn is awake and talking after being in an induced coma for several days.

title.children: Damien Martyn awakes from coma in 'some sort of miracle', thanks public

image.altText: A teenage boy stands outside wearing a black jumper and black beanie.

props.synopsis: Yaron Lavy, from Melbourne, says he had planned to join friends at the Le Constellation bar on New Year's Eve but stopped to get water — a decision that may have saved his life.

title.children: 'I could have been where they are': Aussie teen loses friend in Swiss bar fire

image.altText: a white car with the  boot door open after police found a man stabbed, beate, burnt, tied up inside

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a member of the public contacted police after hearing screams for help from the boot of a white car parked off Woodville Road in Sydney's west.

title.children: Man found in car boot tied up, stabbed, burnt and beaten

image.altText: People walking across a crossing at an intersection with a large Iranian flag on a billboard behind them.

props.synopsis: At least 16 people have been killed in a week of demonstrations fuelled by the rising cost of living.

title.children: Death toll rises in Iran as anti-government protests spread

image.altText: A south Asian man and woman, both old, very sad, stand in front of a metal shack, hold a photo of man, a garland across it.

props.synopsis: Four Hindu men have been killed in Muslim-majority Bangladesh in just over two weeks, and several houses have been burned, leaving the minority community traumatised and fearing for their lives.

title.children: Hindus 'living in fear' after man's public lynching for alleged blasphemy

image.altText: Trump on stage in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: It is entirely fitting that the US is so splintered on its semiquincentennial. Division, for the lion's share of its history, has been its default.

title.children: America's 250th birthday party will serve up a toxic brew of exceptionalism

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis smiles and clenches his fist

props.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis said he didn't think he'd be able to return to tennis after a 2025 blighted by injury. Instead he's made a winning return alongside doubles partner and all-round showman Nick Kyrgios.

title.children: Tears for Thanasi, grins for Nick as Special Ks make their return

image.altText: A man wearing a teal raincoat and helmet stands smiling on a fishing boat.

props.synopsis: The Japanese island of Etajima's oyster industry relies almost entirely on foreign workers due to its aging population.

title.children: Amid a population crisis, this island needs migrants to keep its industry alive

image.altText: Artificial intelligence is growing smarter

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

title.children: How you're already relying on AI, even if you think you're not

image.altText: Close-up of woman wearing a beanie and blistered lips.

props.synopsis: Pakistani women are hiking some of the world's tallest mountains and glacier trails, claiming a space that has long been out of reach.

title.children: 'I went ahead alone': Pakistani woman climbed K2 while pregnant

image.altText: a wide shot of a flat beach, with a small headland in the distance.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man speaks of rescuing three people from rough water on his paddleboard, including a 34-year-old man who was declared dead after he was brought onto the beach.

title.children: Two drownings in two days along NSW South Coast as man dies at Jervis Bay

image.altText: A person's hand buttering a slice of wholemeal bread with margarine

props.synopsis: You might have a personal preference for which spread you use at home, but experts say there are health considerations for which one you use.

title.children: Experts weigh in on the butter versus margarine debate

image.altText: Lila as Evonne gets ready to receive a serve during a game of tennis.

props.synopsis: Lila McGuire on the pressure and joy of playing former world number one and winner of seven grand slam singles titles, tennis legend Evonne Goolagong Cawley.

title.children: The daunting prospect of playing Evonne Goolagong Cawley on screen

image.altText: A aerial image of floodwaters at Winton in Queensland.

props.synopsis: Tourists are stranded in towns dotted across north-west Queensland as rain continues to keep major rivers in flood.

title.children: Tourists stranded, dozens of roads closed as rain continues in outback Queensland

image.altText: Two women in their late sixties smile for a photo in a dining room with tea and biscuits.

props.synopsis: Veronica and Wendy made a pact as teenagers to move back to their hometown to retire together. More than 40 years later they have kept their promise.

title.children: Friends keep teenage pact to retire in the outback together

image.altText: The front of the GrainCorp factory in Numurkah

props.synopsis: Fire crews put out a fire that was described as having the potential to cause an explosion early this morning.

title.children: Major fire at grain storage facility north of Shepparton

image.altText: Erskineville and Macdonaldtown 2025-11-25 11:11:00

props.synopsis: It's the suburb in Sydney that no longer exists — except for a train station — but did it disappear because of scandalous murders or was it just to increase property prices?

title.children: A station and infamous murders: What happened to Sydney's Macdonaldtown?

image.altText: Ian Thorpe in a suit and glasses talking to media with a serious expression in front of a wall of flowers.

props.synopsis: Ian Thorpe, Jess Fox and Lleyton Hewitt are among more than 60 Australian sports stars joining public calls for a Commonwealth royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: 'National crisis': Sports stars call for Bondi federal royal commission

image.altText: Brie cheese.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide retiree who continually ignored orders to remove an unauthorised backyard cheesemaking facility from his suburban home is ordered to pay more than $120,000 in costs, after being found guilty of contempt of court.

title.children: Man told to pay $120,000 over unauthorised backyard cheese business

image.altText: Jedda the staffy sitting in a pink dog bed, raising her hand for a handshake with her owner.

props.synopsis: A new charity is helping low socio-economic households keep their pets, by offering emergency boarding and funding for veterinary care.

title.children: Charity offering pet owners in need vet care, emergency boarding and food

image.altText: A road surrounded by water either side

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Top End has been transformed into a lush green paradise by a cyclone and a monsoon that have brought an unusually heavy start to the annual wet season.

title.children: Top End dams overflow as parks come to life in the wake of Cyclone Fina

image.altText: Forty-spotted pardalote holding a white feather in its beak.

props.synopsis: Donning a helmet and a well-equipped harness, Dr Fernanda Alves looks like she is set to take on an extreme sport. Instead, she is climbing trees to check nesting boxes for a tiny and very rare bird.

title.children: 'So, I had this idea': Scientists dispense insecticide-coated feathers for birds to build nests

image.altText: A general view ahead of the round 24 AFL match between Essendon Bombers and Carlton Blues at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Phoenix Spicer, who played 12 AFL matches for North Melbourne, has died at the age of 23.

title.children: Former North Melbourne AFL player Phoenix Spicer dies aged 23

image.altText: Indra Brown holds a cowboy hat

props.synopsis: With the Winter Olympics on the horizon, 15-year-old Indra Brown wins her first World Cup freeski halfpipe gold in Calgary, with Valentino Guseli also winning gold in the snowboard halfpipe.

title.children: Aussie teen makes history with World Cup gold ahead of Winter Olympics

image.altText: Two hands read braille notation in a white, spiral bound book. The torso of the reader is visible and they wear a red tshirt.

props.synopsis: In the 1820s, Louis Braille devised a raised-dot system of letters, numbers and musical notation. 200 years later, it’s still opening the music world for blind musicians.

title.children: How braille music opens up the music world for blind people

image.altText: A photo of a double story long hotel, with green pillars and a white fence, with a steel gate surrounding it,in a country town,

props.synopsis: For the first time in almost 140 years, Toora's historic pub did not trade over the festive season, leaving locals and visitors with nowhere to drink.

title.children: Summer is here but this town's pub is closed for the first time in 140 years

image.altText: A girl with glasses has her left eye partially covered b a hand holding an eye shield

props.synopsis: A group of researchers is calling on the South Australian government to implement a universal vision screening program for all children attending preschools or day care centres.

title.children: Early eye testing helped Lucy avoid blindness

image.altText: Tasmania Police vehicles.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl from interstate and a 38-year-old Rosebery man, who were both on an all-terrain vehicle, died at the scene on the Murchison Highway after a collision with a ute.

title.children: 15yo girl, man die after their ATV collides with ute on highway

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old French man has been arrested at Sydney International Airport following an alleged sexual assault in Melbourne's CBD in the early hours of New Year's Day.

title.children: Man arrested at Sydney airport after alleged sexual assault in Melbourne

image.altText: A man with cropped hair and stubble smiling and looking out of frame

props.synopsis: Oliver Foran struggled with his mental health after losing his mother to cancer. Now, he is training to set a world record while raising money and awareness for youth mental health.

title.children: Brisbane man training to take on Mount Everest world record
